verses.name: Luke 12:21
verses.text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

verses.name: Luke 12:22
verses.text: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.

verses.name: Luke 12:23
verses.text: The life is more than meat, and the body is more than raiment.

verses.name: Luke 12:24
verses.text: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?

verses.name: Luke 12:25
verses.text: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
